title: Is it possible to vectorize this image as it is in coreldraw?
content:
I dont have idea in which forum this topic should be posted. If anyone know pls do the needfull.

I want to know is it possible to vectorize below image as it is in coreldraw? If yes pls let me know what effect I should use? Pls help me for this. My client need to do it for banner prinitng.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20100203103914im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Artistic-Nature-69079_3927.jpg)
author: artslons

comments.content: You can do a good job of tracing it in Adobe Illustrator CS4 but do not know about CorelDraw as I have never worked with it.
ya i can do it much better in AI....but my customer asked me for CDR file :(
Vectorize it in Illustrator then import the eps file in CorelDraw.

download Inkscape and see how it works for you.  
it's free and i find it very useful. it will create a bunch of layers/shapes.  
play around with the settings to see what you want. often times, i find it the best solution when needing to do something like this. then you can import into illustrator or corel draw and save as to a different file format.
Typesetter beat me to it - you might even be able to cut and paste into CorelDraw from Illustrator

THANK TYOU ALL OF YOU FOR YOUR ADVISE....but for your inforamation i want to tell all of you that any raster effect of AI such as blending, shadow or blur effect does not support by corel. Your ai could not oprn in corel if it having such kind of effect. :(

Then you'll just have tell your client that not all the "effects" of the original could be captured because of the file format they chose and simplify your Illustrator artwork (don't use any of the effects, blending modes, or opacity).

Umm.. CorelDraw has a pretty good trace bitmap function built in. Maybe try it out?

[Corel Draw tracing tutorial](http://web.archive.org/web/20100203103914/http:/www.corel.com/content/pdf/cgsx3/tutorials/dr_4.pdf)
Use Corel Trace, Trace by Advanced Outline.
